title: i'm still gonna keep yasuo permabanned
body: because if there's one thing i know, is that even when AFTER he gets this pretty solid nerf to his q hold times, people are still gonna pick him "who cares if he got nerfed im a god yas" and then they're gonna proceed to get shit on hardcore.

replies.body:
I ban him so I  dont have to deal with him.
It makes the game more fun

I ban him so I don't get one on my team.
Gives me a better chance to win.

Also, (I'm sure this can't be completely true) but I can't remember the last time I met a humble, nice Yasuo player. It's always someone who ends up being a jerk to their teammates, or they flash mastery emote after doing anything. The champion just seems to breed toxic mains.

Yasuo mains in game go one of two ways. They stomp early, get cocky, and singelhandedly throw mid and late, or they get rolled early, pray they get to three items, and suddenly take over despite being 2/12
I play mostly blind pick and let me tell you keep banning him. The second you don't someone will pick him and very likely will do stupid shit. Like it's almost guaranteed.

I will say 1 thing, doesnt matter how good the Yas is, if you nonstop ban him, the 1 you get will feed. Because it probably would have been WEEKS since they last played him. And Yas is a champ that you wanna keep practicing on.

It's the mentality of the players that like to play him. It's probably encouraged through his kit but I'm telling you I'm tired of watching my team's yasuo dash through the enemy's minions to their tower and keep dashing to their death.

> who cares if he got nerfed im a god yas

So, you mean, how every main talks about their main ever?
the difference is: are there good yas mains?
no
There we have it, a credible source.
HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

It's usually the opposite - champion gets a nerf and is still strong and they complain that the champ is now unplayable. 

On that note I've definitely dropped my old mains at times because of them being unplayable. {{champion:2}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:107}} have been through some tough times. Only {{champion:50}} has been at least decent since his release.

That's not the point. People who are mains play their champs, enjoy playing their champs, strength or not. They enjoy outplaying, or simply doing a job well. AP Bard isn't at all strong normally, but I enjoy simply focusing on Dodging shit, and outplaying with portals. It's that which keeps me playing him Mid, not his actual strength.

Not when their champ is nerfed to troll-tier low 40% winrate or below. When they are so bad you can't actually outplay the enemy, only hope to get lucky. 

Playing a 48% winrate champ is very different than playing a 40% winrate champ.
he might just be the first champ to reach 200% ban rate with this new ban system

Yes, they thought making the enemy unable to farm for 10 seconds cause he is holding tornada might be a "bit to strong" and now he can only make you unable to farm for 6 seconds.

> [{quoted}](name=Marcus Phillida,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5EITEZYl,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2017-05-21T14:43:33.616+0000)
>
> Yes, they thought making the enemy unable to farm for 10 seconds cause he is holding tornada might be a "bit to strong" and now he can only make you unable to farm for 6 seconds.

6 seconds is still a long time. I'm surprised they didn't drop it down to 3 seconds, where it's more appropriate, considering how short the CD on his Q is anyways. 

Oh well, when 7.11 hits onto the live server, you can simply zone him out of your games permanently{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
There is still a cd on the q which is 2 seconds at rank 1-3 so 3 seconds would make it impossible to have at least some pressure.

>
> Yes, they thought making the enemy unable to farm for 10 seconds cause he is holding tornada might be a "bit to strong" and now he can only make you unable to farm for 6 seconds.

That's......actually legit, get a hold of yourself and celebrate.

Any day when Yasuo is nerfed is a good day.
ok
Ban yasuo because his kit is generally annoying to play against. Strength doesn't matter sometimes.

I mean, this is kind of a stupid attitude to have because there are actual Yasuo mains out there who are very good with him and may have much better chances of winning on him. It's kind of a self-serving bias to say that all Yasuo players are overconfident baddies. But then again, this is why I got deadly good with veigar.
